intro: Galium wittbergense, commonly known as Wittberg bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny white or pale yellow flowers, which bloom in late summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Galium wittbergense is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to temperate climates.
